New Records: Lautaro Martinez became the youngest player to score a double in a Copa America final since 1935.
Julian Alvarez scored his first international goal in the Copa America, marking his official debut for Argentina.
Key Match Events: Julian Alvarez scored the opening goal in the 48th minute after Canada's goalkeeper Maxime Crepeau collided with his counterpart in the box.
Lautaro Martinez doubled Argentina's lead with a clinical finish in the 87th minute after a well-timed through ball from Lionel Messi.
Pre-Game Insights: Lionel Messi started the match wearing the captain's armband and was seen as the key player to watch.
Canada entered the match with high hopes under new coach Jesse Marsch after their recent performance in the Concacaf Nations League.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentine fans celebrated the team's dominant performance and continued dominance in international football.
Lautaro Martinez was praised for his impact off the bench, contributing two goals to secure the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, marking the first time the Copa America was held in the United States.
Argentina extended their unbeaten run in international matches, having won their last four games.
Others: The match set up an interesting group stage for both teams, with Argentina aiming to continue their streak and Canada looking to rebound from a recent loss to France.
